adminScreen.anonymousUserDescription1: If you choose to allow anonymous access, unauthorized users will have the option to view calendars without the need to log in. This can be useful if you want to allow read-only and/or public access to certain calendars. Unauthorized users will still have the option to log in to increase access rights, e.g. to be able to modify events.
adminScreen.anonymousUserDescription2: To allow access, please provide credentials for a service account that should be used for anonymous users. Please make sure this user has very restricted access in Exchange (ideally only read-only, to certain calendars)!
adminScreen.togglePersonalCalendarDescription: Should the personal calendar section be visible in the Confluence sidebar? (This does not exclude adding personal Outlook calendars to the app.)
adminScreen.configureSharedMailboxesDescription: Below you can configure if shared mailboxes should be available for creating new calendars. It's usually best to create one or more dedicated shared mailboxes for Confluence, so all rights are set correctly. To do this, please use the Powershell script below and enter the mailbox information here afterwards. Please {link} if you have questions regarding this setup.
adminScreen.configureSharedMailboxSubheading: Make a shared mailbox available for calendar creation
adminScreen.enterExistingMailboxLabel: Please enter the name of the (existing) shared mailbox
adminScreen.enterExistingSMTPAddressLabel: Please enter the SMTP address of the (existing) shared mailbox
adminScreen.howToSetUpASharedMailbox: How to set up a shared mailbox
adminScreen.chooseEnvironmentDescription: Please choose which environment you are using.
adminScreen.configureExchangeDescription: Please choose which Exchange proxy you want to use. If you are unsure or want to understand why this is necessary, please check this {link}.

jiraAdminTab.connectToJiraInstanceDescription: You can connect Outlook Calendars for Confluence with Jira, to show dates for issues, sprints and releases. Please enter the URL of the Jira instance that you want to connect to.
jiraAdminTab.jiraUrlLabel: Please enter the URL of your Jira instance including http:// or https://
jiraAdminTab.jiraUrlPlaceholder: Jira URL including http:// or https://
jiraAdminTab.proxyJiraThroughConfluenceDescription: Always proxy requests to Jira through Confluence
jiraAdminTab.createApplicationLinkDescription: Please create a new application link (in Jira Admin --> Applications --> Application Link) with the following data.
jiraAdminTab.createApplicaiontLinkDokuLink: More detailed information how to create the application link can be found here: {link}
jiraAdminTab.yasoonConnectAddonLink: Please install our {link} addon in your Jira system to allow the connection from Confluence.

autoDetect.welcomeOCFCHeader: Welcome to Outlook Calendars for Confluence
autoDetect.welcomeDescription: Welcome to Outlook Calendars for Confluence! To get started, please use this short guide to detect your correct connection settings. In case you want to configure everything manually, just cancel the guide at any time!
autoDetect.enterEmailAndPassword: Please enter your email address, domain username (if available) and password. The process may take up to 2 minutes to complete ☕!
autoDetect.unsupportedExchangeErrorFlagDescription: You are running an unsupported Exchange server!
autoDetect.invalidCredentialsErrorFlagDescription: You may have entered an invalid email, username or password!
autoDetect.successfullyDetectedSettingsLink: We have successfully detected the following configuration. {link}

exchangeSettingsModal.kerberosLinkText: Please choose your Exchange authentication scheme. If you are using Kerberos or something else, please {link}.

O365RegionModal.O365RegionSettingsLink: Please choose your Office 365 region. If you are unsure, please ask your IT support or check {link}.

proxySettingsModal.selfHostDescription: It is possible to self-host the required Exchange Web Services (EWS) proxy. More information can be found {link1}. Please make sure to {link2} us, if you'd like to do so!

spaceAdminScreen.selectSpaceVisibilityHeader: Select the visibility of the Space-Calendar

enableLoggingModal.heading: Enable Support Logging
enableLoggingModal.dataIsSentDescription: If support logging is enabled, anonymized data will be sent to our server in case of an error while using our app.
enableLoggingModal.dataHelpsDevelopersAndSupportDescription: This data is monitored by our developers and allows us to identify issues that may occur during the use of Outlook Calendars for Confluence. You may then be contacted by our support team. This makes it possible to constantly improve our app.
enableLoggingModal.dataIsDeletedAfter30DaysDescription: Regardless of this, all data will be automatically deleted after 30 days.
enableLoggingModal.openSupportTicketDescriptionWithLink: If you have any issues using our app you can also, {link}.

welcomeTour.welcomeHeading: Welcome to Outlook Calendars for Confluence. You can use the calendar in the following ways.
welcomeTour.personalCalendar: The personal calendar is the place for all Outlook calendars that are relevant to you. Only you can access this calendar view.
welcomeTour.spaceCalendar: Space calendars are accessible for everyone with access to the space. It's the perfect place to view all calendars relevant to the project.
welcomeTour.macroCalendar: Use the calendar macro to embed Outlook calendars in any Confluence page to schedule meetings or share dates with your team.
welcomeTour.openCalendars: You can easily open personal or shared Outlook calendars. In addition, you can overlay Jira or Trello due dates. Give your team the best possible overview to plan and track a project.
welcomeTour.createEvents: You can create personal or shared Outlook events, as well as edit existing events. Easily schedule events even in large teams.

errorBoundary.persistDescription: If this error persists please open a support ticket.

officeLoginModal.officeLoginDescription: You’re using Outlook Calendars for Confluence for the first time. Please login with your {{loginType}}
officeLoginModal.useOwnAccountDescription: Note: Please use your own account for logging in. You will be able to open any other calendar from your organization afterwards.

timeZoneModal.timeZoneNote: Note: You will be able to change the time zone afterwards!

adminHelpTab.documentationDescription: It's always a good idea to check out our documentation first, we try to answer common questions there. Use the quick links below to get started!
adminHelpTab.contactUsDescription: In case you need technical help or just want to learn about our product, we are happy to help!
